head.title: Metadata Redactions from Documents in {{ProgLang}}
head.description: Redact sensitive metadata in {{ProgLang}} by applying filters for documents of different formats

header.title: Redact Title Metadata from {{EXT}} Document in {{ProgLang}}
header.description: GroupDocs.Redactions API allows to search and then update or remove any confidential data from metadata of a document.

about.title: What is Metadata Redaction?
about.h1: Mostly people are concerned with text redaction of a document. But metadata redaction is equally as important. Metadata is the hidden data of a document that can contain confidential inforation which you might not want to share with other. Metadata redaction refers to the removal of unwanted or confidential information from electronic documents. Metadata of a document includes author name, category, company name, comments, creation time, last updated and many more. Sometimes you need to completely delete unwanted metadata fields or you might want to update their values. With GroupDocs.Redaction API you can apply metadata redactions to any of these metadata properties. You can change or delete them by filtering the metadata you want. In this guide we will explain how you can redact title metadata from {{EXT}} document in {{ProgLang}}.

content_left.step_1: Following code allows you to search and redact sensitive data from a {{EXT}} document. You can set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. to MetadataFilter.Title. It will leave the regular expressions matches undone in all metadata items, except "Title" property:

content_right.step_1: Create an instance of [Redactor](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction/redactor) class & upload {{EXT}} file
content_right.step_2: Create an instance of [MetadataSearchRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction.redactions/metadatasearchredaction) class to find and replace sensitive data from document's metadata
content_right.step_3: Set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. Use MetadataFilter.Title in below code

content_left.step_1: You can replace all or specific metadata in the document with empty (blank or minimal) values using EraseMetadataRedaction class. Following code shows how you can filter and then remove a metadata property from a {{EXT}} document.The example below blanks out all properties of the document:

content_right.step_1: Create an instance of [Redactor](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction/redactor) class & upload {{EXT}} file
content_right.step_2: Create an instance of [EraseMetadataRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction.redactions/erasemetadataredaction) to remove metadata of the document
content_right.step_3: Set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. Replace MetadataFilter.All with MetadataFilter.Title in below code

content_left.description: GroupDocs.Redaction for .NET supports any 32-bit or 64-bit operating system where .NET platform is installed. It does not require any external software or third party tool to be installed. For complete system requirements guide, please visit [system requirements](https://docs.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/system-requirements)
content_left.step_1: Operating Systems: Microsoft Windows, Linux, MacOS
content_left.step_2: Development Environment: NetBeans, Intellij IDEA, Eclipse etc
content_left.step_3: Java Runtime Environment: J2SE 6.0 and above
content_left.step_4: Get the latest version of GroupDocs.Redaction for Java from [Maven](https://repository.groupdocs.com/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/repo/com/groupdocs/groupdocs-redaction)

content_right.step_1: Install from command line as ```nuget install GroupDocs.Redaction``` or via Package Manager Console of Visual Studio with ```Install-Package GroupDocs.Redaction```.
content_right.step_2: Alternatively, get the offline MSI installer or DLLs in a ZIP file from [downloads](https://downloads.groupdocs.com/redaction/net), and reference it in your project manually.
